title: Tampa Bay Buccaneers player Alex Cappa broke arm in second quarter of game against the Saints
text:
Tampa Bay Buccaneers offensive lineman Alex Cappa broke his arm during Sunday's face-off against the New Orleans Saints - but he kept toughed it out and finished the game.

Cappa broke his left arm during the second quarter of the game, Buccaneers head coach Bruce Arians revealed to reporters Monday.

The 24-year-old star athlete had initially told reporters after the game that his injury was 'just a bruise', but it turned out to be much more severe.

Despite the 31-24 loss against the Saints, Cappa toughed it out on the field playing all 59 offensive snaps and an additional four snaps on special teams.

Tampa Bay Buccaneers offensive lineman Alex Cappa, 24, broke his left arm during the second quarter of Sunday's face-off against the New Orleans Saints, but continued to play the entire game

He broke his left arm where there were just nine minutes left in the second quarter, but brushed it off as a bruise to inquiring reporters

Alex Cappa broke his left arm on this play. There was nine minutes left in the 2nd quarter. He FINISHED THE GAME. Unreal toughness. #Bucsfilm2019wk5 pic.twitter.com/uJ3eKnjPyJ — Steven Cheah (@StevenCheah) October 8, 2019

'I commend Alex Cappa. He broke his arm in the second quarter and played the entire game,' Arians said praising him Monday according to USA Today.

'He’ll miss a few weeks. But it’s next man up,' he added.

Backup guard Earl Watford will likely replace Cappa on the field as he heals from his injury.

'I commend Alex Cappa. He broke his arm in the second quarter and played the entire game,' Buccaneers coach Bruce Arians told reporters on Monday

He continued to play the rest of the game despite his injuries

Cappa wil likely be benched for the next few weeks and will miss next wee's match in London against the Carolina Panthers

Cappa is entering his second season with Tampa Bay. It's his first season as a full-time starter after he was chosen in the third round of the 218 draft, No. 94 pick overall.

Cappa wasn't the only injured player during Sunday's intense game. Right tackle Demar Dotson suffered a hamstring injury add will miss Week 6's game against the Carolina Panthers in London.

'We can't make excuses, but we'll have a new right side of our line, probably,' Arians said.
description: Tampa Bay Buccaneers offensive lineman Alex Cappa, 24, broke his left arm during the second quarter of Sunday's game against the New Orleans Saints, but continued to play the entire game.
